definition: lit. ten thousand mile horse/fine steed
thousand
Li (surname)

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
lit. there are many swift horses, but very few who can spot them (idiom)/fig. many have talent, but few can recognize talent when they see it
pinyin: qian1 li3 ma3 chang2 you3 , er2 Bo2 Le4 bu4 chang2 you3
containing_words.word: 千里馬常有，而伯樂不常有

sentences.english: The horse arrived, and it was a rare " thousand-mile".
sentences.chinese: 馬到了，果然是一匹天下少有的千里馬。

sentences.english: You can take metro, it is Yonggwang station of Chollima line.
sentences.chinese: 您可搭乘平壤地鐵，千里馬線，榮光車站。

sentences.english: We thank Ksitigarbha for his help and Buddy Horse of A Thousand Miles for his leading the road.
sentences.chinese: 我們感謝千里馬的領路，感激地藏王的普渡。

sentences.english: Chollima's chances of winning might be as mythical as the horse of their name.
sentences.chinese: 千里馬球隊獲勝的希望就像他的名字一樣遙不可及。

sentences.english: Wei plays down his role as the guy who spotted the winning horse.
sentences.chinese: 韋必達在其中做了伯樂，認出了千里馬。

sentences.english: Chollima who will become the real estate industry?
sentences.chinese: 千里馬誰將成爲房地產行業？

sentences.english: Only their own people in all its aspects has been recognized only someone know Chollima .
sentences.chinese: 只有自己的各方面得到人家認可纔會有人識千里馬。

sentences.english: I wish you are always running horse.
sentences.chinese: 願你是永遠奔騰的千里馬。

definition: to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
sea of learning, no horizon (idiom); no limits to what one still has to learn/ars longa, vita brevis
transition
accepted theory or formulation
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
with a will, you can achieve anything (idiom); cf 精誠所至，金石為開|精诚所至，金石为开[jing1 cheng2 suo3 zhi4 , jin1 shi2 wei4 kai1]
Manchurian language
to emerge victorious in every battle/to be ever-victorious
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
magnificent army with thousands of men and horses (idiom); impressive display of manpower/all the King's horses and all the King's men
It takes ten years to nurture a tree, but a hundred years to train a man (idiom)/fig. a good education program takes a long time to develop/cf. 十年樹木，百年樹人|十年树木，百年树人
to wait for action after having accumulated power, energy etc
lit. as close as lips and teeth (idiom); closely related/interdependent
lit. wind from an empty cave (idiom)/fig. unfounded (story)/baseless (claim)
